metatype.name: Global update policy for Maven repositories
Locattion of Maven security settings file
Size
metatype.description: size of the log to keep in memory

metatype.name: Pattern
metatype.description: Pattern used to display log entries

metatype.name: Storage directory
metatype.description: the directory used as a storage for configurations

metatype.name: SSH Port
metatype.description: port of the SSH daemon

metatype.name: SSH Host
metatype.description: name of the host used to bind the SSH daemon

metatype.name: SSH Realm
metatype.description: name of the JAAS realm to use for SSH authentication

metatype.name: Host key
metatype.description: location of the host key for SSH

metatype.name: Key size
metatype.description: Secret key size in 1024, 2048, 3072, or 4096

metatype.name: Key algorithm
metatype.description: Host key algorithm in DSA, RSA, etc

metatype.name: RMI Registry Host
metatype.description: host of the registry for the exported RMI service. Blank for all interfaces

metatype.name: RMI Registry Port
metatype.description: port of the registry for the exported RMI service

metatype.name: RMI Server Host
metatype.description: host of the server for the exported RMI objects. Blank for all interfaces

metatype.name: RMI Server Port
metatype.description: port of the server for the exported RMI objects

metatype.name: Realm
metatype.description: name of the JAAS realm used for authentication

metatype.name: Service Url
metatype.description: the service URL for the JMXConnectorServer

metatype.name: Daemon
metatype.description: whether any threads started for the JMXConnectorServer should be started as daemon threads

metatype.name: Threaded
metatype.description: whether the JMXConnectorServer should be started in a separate thread

metatype.name: ObjectName
metatype.description: the ObjectName used to register the JMXConnectorServer

metatype.name: Secured
metatype.description: whether to start MBean server with SSL

metatype.name: KeyStore Availability Timeout
metatype.description: Number of milliseconds waiting for keystore to be loaded.

metatype.name: Secure Algorithm
metatype.description: Algorithm to use

metatype.name: Secure Protocol
metatype.description: Protocol to use

metatype.name: Keystore Name
metatype.description: Keystore name from keystore manager

metatype.name: Key Alias
metatype.description: Key alias to be used with secured connector

metatype.name: Truststore Name
metatype.description: Truststore name from keystore manager

metatype.name: Authenticator Type
metatype.description: Authenticator to use. Available values are "none", "password", and "certificate".

metatype.name: Thread Pool Size
metatype.description: The size of the thread pool used for event delivery. The default value is 20. Increase in case of a large amount of events. A value of less then 2 triggers the default value. If the pool is exhausted, event delivery is blocked until a thread becomes available from the pool. Each event is delivered in a thread from the pool unless the ignore timeouts is configured for the receiving event handler.

metatype.name: Async/sync Thread Pool Ratio
metatype.description: The ratio of asynchronous to synchronous threads in the internal thread pool. Ratio must be positive and may be adjusted to represent the distribution of post to send operations.  Applications with higher number of post operations should have a higher ratio.

metatype.name: Timeout
metatype.description: The black-listing timeout in milliseconds. The default value is 5000. Increase or decrease at own discretion. A value of less then 100 turns timeouts off. Any other value is the time in milliseconds granted to each event handler before it gets blacklisted

metatype.name: Require Topic
metatype.description: Are event handlers required to be registered with a topic? This is enabled by default. The specification says that event handlers must register with a list of topics they are interested in. Disabling this setting will enable that handlers without a topic are receiving all events (i.e., they are treated the same as with a topic=*).

metatype.name: Ignore Timeouts
metatype.description: Configure event handlers to be called without a timeout. If a timeout is configured by default all event handlers are called using the timeout. For performance optimization it is possible to configure event handlers where the timeout handling is not used - this reduces the thread usage from the thread pools as the timout handling requires an additional thread to call the event handler. However, the application should work without this configuration property. It is a pure optimization! The value is a list of strings. If a string ends with a dot, all handlers in exactly this package are ignored. If the string ends with a star, all handlers in this package and all subpackages are ignored. If the string neither ends with a dot nor with a star, this is assumed to define an exact class name.

metatype.name: Ignore Topics
metatype.description: For performance optimization it is possible to configure topics which are ignored by the event admin implementation. In this case, a event is not delivered to registered event handlers. The value is a list of strings (separated by comma). If a single value ends with a dot, all topics in exactly this package are ignored. If a single value ends with a star, all topics in this package and all sub packages are ignored. If a single value neither ends with a dot nor with a start, this is assumed to define an exact topic. A single star can be used to disable delivery completely.

metatype.name: realm.name
metatype.description: realm.description

value.name: Apache Felix Web Console Event Plugin

metatype.name: Maximum Events
metatype.description: The maximum number of events displayed in the plugin.

metatype.name: Protocol
metatype.description: The protocol used to advertise the system. When selecting the protocol, be sure to enter the port number corresponding to that protocol.

metatype.name: Host
metatype.description: The host name or IP address used to advertise the system. Possibilities include the address of a single node of that of a load balancer in a multi-node deployment. NOTE: Does not change the address the system runs on.

metatype.name: Port
metatype.description: The port used to advertise the system. Possibilities include the port of a single node of that of a load balancer in a multi-node deployment. NOTE: Does not change the port the system runs on.

metatype.name: Site Name
metatype.description: The unique name of this instance. This name will be provided via web services that ask for the name.

metatype.name: Version
metatype.description: The version of this instance.

metatype.name: Organization
metatype.description: The name of the organization that runs this instance.

metatype.name: Site contact
metatype.description: The email address of the site contact

metatype.name: Enable System Usage Message
metatype.description: Turns on a system usage message, which is shown when the Search Application is opened

metatype.name: System Usage Message Title
metatype.description: A title for the system usage Message when the application is opened

metatype.name: System Usage Message
metatype.description: A system usage message to be displayed to the user each time the user opens the application

metatype.name: Show System Usage Message once per session
metatype.description: With this selected, the system usage message will be shown once for each browser session.  Uncheck this to have the usage message appear every time the search window is opened or refreshed.

metatype.name: Header
metatype.description: Specifies the header text to be rendered on all pages.

metatype.name: Footer
metatype.description: Specifies the footer text to be rendered on all pages.

metatype.name: Text Color
metatype.description: Specifies the Text Color of the Header and Footer.  Use html css colors or #rrggbb.

metatype.name: Background Color
metatype.description: Specifies the Background Color of the Header and Footer.  Use html css colors or #rrggbb.

metatype.name: Metrics Max Threshold
metatype.description: Max value a data sample can be for any metric (used to suppress spike data on metrics graphs)

metatype.name: Solr URL
metatype.description: HTTP URL of Solr 4.x Server.

metatype.name: Context Realms
metatype.description: List of realms supporting each context. Provided realms are: DDF, karaf. Example: /=DDF

metatype.name: Authentication Types
metatype.description: List of authentication types required for each context. List of default valid authentication types are: SAML, BASIC, PKI, GUEST. Example: /context=AUTH1|AUTH2|AUTH3

metatype.name: Required Attributes
metatype.description: List of attributes required for each Web Context. Example: /context={role=role1|role2;type=type1}

metatype.name: White Listed Contexts
metatype.description: List of contexts that will not use security. Note that sub-contexts to ones listed here will also skip security, unless authentication types are provided for it. For example: if /foo is listed here, then /foo/bar will also not require any sort of authentication. However, if /foo is listed and /foo/bar has authentication types provided in the 'Authentication Types' field, then that more specific policy will be used.

value.name: Security STS Property File Claims Handler

metatype.name: Role Claim Type:
metatype.description: Role claim URI.

metatype.name: User Map File:
metatype.description: Location of the file which contains user attribute maps to use.

metatype.name: CRL file location:
metatype.description: Sets the location that the CRL file is at.

metatype.name: Enable CRL Checking:
metatype.description: Enables checking incoming requests with a file-based CRL and revoking requests that contain invalid certificates.

metatype.name: SAML Assertion Lifetime:
metatype.description: Set the number of seconds that an issued SAML assertion will be good for.

metatype.name: Token Issuer:
metatype.description: The name of the server issuing tokens. Generally this is the cn or hostname of this machine on the network.

metatype.name: Signature Username:
metatype.description: Alias of the private key in the STS Server's keystore used to sign messages.

metatype.name: Encryption Username:
metatype.description: Alias of the private key in the STS Server's keystore used to encrypt messages.

metatype.name: Realms
metatype.description: The realms to be validated by this validator.

metatype.name: Use Action Permissions
metatype.description: Checks authorization using action-based permissions for the service being called

metatype.name: Roles
metatype.description: Comma-delimited list of roles that a user could have in order to be permitted for restricted actions. Defaults to admin.

metatype.name: Open Action List
metatype.description: Comma-delimited list of actions that are open for any role to access. No actions are set by default.

metatype.name: Match-All Mappings
metatype.description: Comma-delimited list of 'Match-All' subject attribute to Metacard attribute mapping. All values of this metacard key must be present in the corresponding subject key values. Format is subjectAttrName=metacardAttrName.

metatype.name: Match-One Mappings
metatype.description: Comma-delimited list of 'Match-One' subject attribute to Metacard attribute mapping. One value of this metacard key must be present in the corresponding subject key values. Format is subjectAttrName=metacardAttrName.

metatype.name: SAML Assertion Type:
metatype.description: The version of SAML to use. Most services require SAML v2.0. Changing this value from the default could cause services to stop responding.

metatype.name: SAML Key Type:
metatype.description: The key type to use with SAML. Most services require Bearer. Changing this value from the default could cause services to stop responding.

metatype.name: SAML Key Size:
metatype.description: The key size to use with SAML. The default key size is 256 and this is fine for most applications. Changing this value from the default could cause services to stop responding.

metatype.name: Use Key:
metatype.description: Signals whether or not the STS Client should supply a public key to embed as the proof key. Changing this value from the default could cause services to stop responding.

metatype.name: STS WSDL Address:
metatype.description: STS WSDL Address

metatype.name: STS Endpoint Name:
metatype.description: STS Endpoint Name.

metatype.name: STS Service Name:
metatype.description: STS Service Name.

metatype.name: Signature Properties:
metatype.description: Path to Signature crypto properties. This path can be part of the classpath, relative to ddf.home, or an absolute path on the system.

metatype.name: Encryption Properties:
metatype.description: Path to Encryption crypto properties file. This path can be part of the classpath, relative to ddf.home, or an absolute path on the system.

metatype.name: STS Properties:
metatype.description: Path to STS crypto properties file. This path can be part of the classpath, relative to ddf.home, or an absolute path on the system.

metatype.name: Claims:
metatype.description: Comma-delimited list of claims that should be requested by the STS.

metatype.name: Session Timeout (in minutes)
metatype.description: The amount of minutes after a session has been inactive that it should be invalidated.

metatype.name: Header
metatype.description: Specifies the header text to be rendered on the Login page

metatype.name: Footer
metatype.description: Specifies the footer text to be rendered on the Login page

metatype.name: Style
metatype.description: Specifies the style of the Header and Footer.

metatype.name: Text Color
metatype.description: Specifies the text color of the Header and Footer.

metatype.name: Supported Realms
metatype.description: The realms that this validator supports.

configurations.name: Security STS Anonymous Claims Handler
configurations.bundle_name: DDF :: Security :: STS :: Anonymous Claims Handler

metatype.name: Attributes
metatype.description: The attributes to be returned for any Anonymous user.

metatype.name: Deny Anonymous Access
metatype.description: If set to true, no anonymous access will be allowed via this anonymous interceptor. If set to             false, this interceptor will generate anonymous tokens for incoming requests that lack a WS-Security header.

metatype.name: Override Endpoint Policies
metatype.description: If checked, forces anonymous tokens to be created and inserted into the incoming request regardless             of whether the policy requires an issued token. If set to false, if the endpoint policies cannot be satisfied,             no changes will be made to the incoming request. This only applies to incoming requests that lack a WS-Security             header - those with a WS-Security header are passed through unchanged.

metatype.name: Header
metatype.description: Specifies the header text to be rendered on the Administrator Console

metatype.name: Footer
metatype.description: Specifies the footer text to be rendered on the Administrator Console

metatype.name: Style
metatype.description: Specifies the style of the Header and Footer.

metatype.name: Text Color
metatype.description: Specifies the text color of the Header and Footer.

metatype.name: Ignored Installer Applications
metatype.description: Comma delimited list (appName,appName2,...appNameN) of applications that will be disabled in the installer

metatype.name: Use the bundle activation policy when starting
Name
metatype.description: Use name 'default' to change the default work queue settings

metatype.name: Command
metatype.description: Shell command to be used within the container. For example, log:set DEBUG

metatype.name: Interval in seconds
metatype.description: The interval of time in seconds between each execution. Must be a positive integer. For example, 3600 is 1 hour.

metatype.name: File Extensions to Mime Types
metatype.description: List of key/value pairs where key is the file extension and value is the mime type, e.g., nitf=image/nitf
